h2: Content Drives Traffic, Which Leads To Revenue
Deindexing Pages That Don’t Bring Organic Traffic
Installing Redirects From Previous Articles to New Ones
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuImproving Content Marketing Strategy Through Consolidation To Drive SEO ResultsIs your website not ranking on search engines? Well, it could be because of poor SEO! Have you ever thought that your old content could be dragging your website’s authority down?
Michael Krieger
Is your website not ranking on search engines? Well, it could be because of poor SEO! Have you ever thought that your old content could be dragging your website’s authority down?
Or perhaps, it is just a result of too many irrelevant pages on your website. Focus your content marketing strategy on creating fewer, but more detailed pages on your website.

Now the question arises, what could be done in this situation? Well, you must have heard of the saying, “Content is King”. Did you know publishing more content doesn’t necessarily mean more traffic? To rank your website on Google and other search engines, focus on creating high-quality, relatable content.

SEO and content go hand in hand. Engaging content increases website traffic, improving search engine rankings and strengthening your brand. However, for this, you need to develop a comprehensive content marketing strategy. In fact, recent studies show that pages with more than 2000 words tend to rank much better than pages with shorter word lengths.

Instead of writing short blogs, your content marketing strategy should focus on creating thorough and in-depth articles to rank better. If you want your blog to stand out amongst 440 million other blogs, you need to do some work.
How do you start improving your content marketing strategy through consolidation?
This article offers helpful tips to enhance your content and improve your website's ranking in search engine results.
It's crucial to audit your website's content, even if you choose the right words.

paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuThe Top Benefits of Search Engine Advertising: Boosting Your Online Presence and Driving ConversionsIn today’s competitive online landscape, search engine advertising has become a crucial tool for businesses looking to enhance their online...
Michael Krieger

In today's competitive online environment, search engine advertising is essential for businesses wanting to improve their online presence and increase conversions. From small startups to multinational corporations, leveraging the power of search engine advertising can significantly impact a company’s bottom line. This article discusses the key benefits of incorporating search engine advertising into your digital marketing strategy. Using Google Ads and Microsoft Ads effectively can help you attract targeted traffic, enhance brand visibility, and increase sales and conversions. If you're new to online advertising or want to improve your strategies, this article will show you how search engine advertising can elevate your business in the digital world.

Increased Exposure: Search engine advertising increases your brand's visibility to potential customers searching for related products or services. This increased visibility can lead to higher brand recognition and awareness among your target audience.

Increasing Relevance and Engagement: Targeting a specific audience allows you to craft ad copy that directly addresses their needs and interests, enhancing relevance and engagement. This increased relevance leads to higher engagement rates and ultimately drives more conversions for your business.

Maximizing ROI: Targeting specific audiences helps you efficiently spend your advertising budget on those most likely to become customers, maximizing your return on investment. This targeted approach helps streamline your marketing efforts and optimize your ad spend for better results.

With search engine advertising, you can target customers who are actively searching for products or services like yours. This precision targeting leads to higher conversion rates and a better return on investment.

Salesperson productivity is a key factor that determines success in many businesses. Implementing an effective sales process is crucial for businesses to enhance salesperson productivity and drive profitable sales growth. Several factors influence the productivity of a sales team, including the level of work ethic and how technology is used.
How do you increase salesperson productivity without the need for them to work harder?
Here are 5 tips to help improve salespeople's productivity & ensure they build more high quality relationships:

Plan your day using time blocking - Productive days often begin when a sales team outlines their priorities the night before. Implementing a time blocking strategy is crucial, as they should schedule dedicated time to prospect and in-person meetings. Incorporate energy-boosting activities like gym workouts or meditation into a time-blocking strategy. This empowers sales representatives to minimize unproductive time spent on administrative tasks and focus more on their core responsibilities. Each day’s progress should be reflected upon to evaluate the effectiveness of time blocking. You may want to consider experimenting with scheduling slightly shorter meetings to get more done. Time blocking helps sales reps stay focused by encouraging them to switch activities every hour, keeping their minds fresh.

Avoid distractions from email— Sales reps can waste time on it due to numerous messages trying to grab their attention. Set specific times during the day to check your email. This will help you respond to important messages while staying focused on your tasks. Salespeople should use marketing automation tools to handle routine emails and get reminders for sending personalized ones. Use best practices like optimized subject lines and a DKIM-based email platform to ensure your emails land in recipients' primary inboxes.

Remain Productive When You Are Traveling – Stay productive while traveling by using mobile devices to access your company’s CRM. This helps keep productivity high as it is possible to efficiently respond to important developments throughout each day. After all, this is one of the strategies that many successful sales representatives use.

Automate Everything That You Can – Salespeople can boost productivity by automating as many tasks as possible and concentrating on their strengths. Identify tasks that can be automated, and then explore the most ideal solutions to address them. Automated emails may seem impersonal, but time is limited. This strategy frees up time for building deeper relationships, which can boost sales.

Strengthen Inbound Marketing Campaigns – Strengthen your inbound marketing campaigns to provide your sales reps with warmer leads. Send prospects relevant content like case studies, blog articles, and infographics to educate them about solutions that meet their needs.

Necessity of Using Crypto Market Makers
When To Use a Crypto Market Maker
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuWhat is Crypto Market Making?For many businesses, it may seem that it is almost next to impossible to conquer ever-changing algorithms on popular social media platforms such as Instagram. Michael Krieger

Cryptocurrency has become a popular investment opportunity in recent years, with many investors flocking to the market in search of high returns. However, the volatile nature of the crypto market can make investing in digital assets risky, with sudden price fluctuations and illiquidity posing significant challenges. This is where crypto market makers come in, playing a crucial role in ensuring market stability and liquidity.

In this article, we will explore the world of crypto market-making, including what it is, how the crypto market making strategy works, and actually why use a crypto market maker. So, let’s dive into the world of cryptocurrency market-making and learn how it can benefit investors and token projects.

Market making in crypto has a significant role to play, just like their counterparts in traditional finance. These entities, often specialized trading firms or financial institutions, use their capital to buy and sell cryptocurrencies. Thereby, they provide necessary liquidity to the market. This continuous flow of buying and selling activity ensures that trades can be executed swiftly without causing significant price fluctuations, thus stabilizing the crypto market.

Crypto market makers use advanced algorithmic trading strategies to maintain an active presence on both sides of the order book, helping to narrow the bid-ask spread. Spread is the difference between the highest price a buyer is willing to pay and the lowest price a seller is willing to accept.

The necessity of utilizing crypto market making services arises from the volatility and sometimes illiquid nature of cryptocurrency markets. Market makers reduce these challenges by enhancing market depth and liquidity. This, in turn, facilitates smoother transactions and more stable prices for traders and investors. Market makers are essential for both large-cap assets such as BTC (with a market cap of $ 1,283.65 billion), DOGE (Dogecoin market cap is $23.73 billion), and others, as well as for low-cap assets that require trading volume increase.

Crypto market makers function by setting up a crypto market making strategy that includes maintaining a list of buy and sell orders. This strategy involves calculating and constantly adjusting the quantities and prices of these orders to reflect the current market conditions. The goal is to minimize the spread and prevent large price gaps, allowing other traders to execute their trades efficiently and at fair prices.

Let’s see how the symmetric market making strategy in crypto works, taking the DOGE coin as an example. This strategy involves continuously placing buy and sell limit orders around the current market price to capture the bid-ask spread while providing liquidity. How this might work for DOGE with its present price of $0,16:
Set fixed spread. The market maker decides on a fixed percentage for the spread, say, 0.2%.

paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuHow to Establish High Quality Lead Generation Using Marketing AutomationAre you looking to increase profitability by generating high-quality leads from your website? Michael Krieger

Are you looking to increase profitability by generating high-quality leads from your website? Do you often feel short on time and find it challenging to integrate important business development tasks into your day? The largest bottleneck to business growth is time, especially considering that every business has objectives to meet. Relieve that bottleneck by deploying a marketing automation tool to help reduce the time required to manage lead generation processes.

Many businesses aim to boost their website traffic through social media, SEO, or advertising, but that's only part of the challenge. Maximizing website traffic is pointless if it doesn't contribute to your business growth and profits. Engage your customers effectively during their buying journey, as it often takes seven interactions for them to feel ready to do business with you.

To establish an effective lead generation campaign, you first need to define your targeted customer personas. To help you do this, you may want to consider running polls on social media and by interviewing your customers. Depending on the exact dynamics of your company, you may have multiple services that appeal to different customer personas. Your buyer personas only can help your company improve its brand messaging, and become more engaging with its ideal customers. Focus on your top 3 or 4 customer personas, as they account for 90% of a company's sales, according to Mark W. Schaefer's study. Then, prioritize your personas so that your company dedicates a higher level of resources to ones with higher growth potential.

Create a landing page that clearly communicates your unique value to your target customer. Create a form to gather user contact information in exchange for free content, which will be sent through an automated email. Allow the user to download the content through a link in the email. Be sure to place the inquiry form in a place such that a visitor does not need to scroll to see the form. Next, encourage the user with a call to action that advances their buying journey.

Don’t forget to send lead nurturing emails to remain top of mind and continue building a relationship with your prospects. Of course, you ultimately would want the prospect to purchase your service. Though, you would want to ensure that you do not annoy prospects by just sending out a link to buy your offering. Instead, offer additional content that is of interest to the prospect, introduce complementary offerings, or advertise a limited-time promotion. After adding more content to your emails, include a call to action below it to make it easy for prospects to purchase your service. Lead nurturing is most effective when you use collected data to personalize emails, generating 18 times more revenue than standard broadcasts.

The real power of marketing automation then shows up when lead scoring is leveraged to dynamically prioritize your CRM. Lead scoring includes a user's interactions on websites, social media, and email campaigns. Tracking begins when a customer submits their information on a landing page or clicks on a received email. Higher lead scores indicate prospects more likely to purchase, allowing your sales team to focus on those most likely to convert.

We recommend strategically following this process using a reputable marketing automation tool. Achieving ROI is easy because the savings from increased productivity usually outweigh the software costs, even with just one sales employee. A marketing automation tool can enhance your lead generation strategy and increase your business's long-term success.

h1: The 7 Best Strategic Inbound Marketing Practices
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuThe 7 Best Strategic Inbound Marketing PracticesInbound marketing is a critical part of a marketing strategy that generates business growth. Companies deploy inbound marketing programs to make it easy for their prospects to find them on the internet. Michael Krieger

Inbound marketing is a critical part of a marketing strategy that generates business growth. Companies deploy inbound marketing programs to make it easy for their prospects to find them on the internet. Many consumers prefer a "soft sell" approach, gathering information to solve their problems before interacting with a company. Many tend to ignore outright marketing messages due to their overwhelming presence. Inbound marketing generates warm leads that are easier to convert than cold calling or traditional advertising.

Understanding the human psyche is crucial to avoid wasting money on ineffective campaigns. Inbound marketing is a passive method of building trust with customers, and can help in increasing sales with strategic execution. Inbound marketing strategies focus on understanding psychology to create effective campaigns that drive business growth. With the highest level of strategic execution, your marketing campaigns could go viral, which will only amplify your success.
Most strategies are relatively inexpensive to execute since engagement will increase the success of your campaign.
Visitors become warmer and more receptive as they receive more relevant content that appeals to them.

Send email campaigns out to an organically built email list. Buying a list can waste money and seriously damage your reputation. While sending your first campaign with a purchased email list might be delivered into your recipients’ primary inboxes, subsequent emails that you send are highly likely to be  delivered into “spam” or “promotions” folders. If people mark your first email as "spam," it can prevent even legitimate contacts from receiving your emails. Email campaigns sent to an organically built list are more likely to land in recipients' inboxes, increasing the chances of long-term engagement.
Genuinely provide high quality content that is relevant and useful to your audience to build credibility with your audience.
Offer continuous support to your clients as part of your inbound marketing strategy. This strengthens customer loyalty and creates opportunities to upsell additional products and services.
Remember that you are gradually building trust with your prospects and clients over time to build or strengthen business relationships.

h1: 5 Lead Generation Tactics Improved with Marketing Automation
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menu5 Lead Generation Tactics Improved with Marketing AutomationWhile you can increase the number of leads in your sales funnel by deploying lead-generating tactics, you can maximize their benefits using marketing automation tools. Marketing automation you to streamline many repetitive and time-consuming marketing activities in relation to communicating with and nurturing your leads.
Michael Krieger

While you can increase the number of leads in your sales funnel by deploying lead-generating tactics, you can maximize their benefits using marketing automation tools. Marketing automation you to streamline many repetitive and time-consuming marketing activities in relation to communicating with and nurturing your leads.
Read on to see the 5 ways of how marketing automation can enhance lead generation tactics:

Search engine marketing is an effective strategy for generating leads because it serves your ad to customers based on the words they used when searching for something. For example, if your business is a carpet cleaning service and potential customers typed “cleaning service near me” in their search engine, your SEM ad would be displayed above or to the right of the organic search results. With SEM, you know your customer is already searching for the products or services your company provides, making this a valuable lead-generation tactic.
Before we investigate how marketing automation improves this process, here are three steps to get started with SEM:

These are the keywords you think people would type in when searching for the type of products and services your business provides. It’s a good idea to mix it up between long and short search terms not only to give yourself a variety of keywords to choose from but also because the length of the keyword is indicative of where the buyer is in their journey. Someone searching “cleaning services” is more likely at the beginning of their search as opposed to someone searching “cleaning services that use environmentally safe products.” Longer or long-tail keywords are used by customers who are typically better leads because they’ve identified their exact problem and are actively searching for the solution.

Once you’ve identified your keywords, you’re now able to bid on how much you want to pay per click (PPC) on your keywords. One important thing to keep in mind is that shorter keywords may be more competitive and ultimately cost more because shorter search terms are often the broadest. On the flip side of this, long-tail keywords may be cheaper because they’re much more specific. With either short or long-tail keywords, always keep in mind that other marketers in your industry may be bidding on the same keywords, so the higher you can bid the better.

SEM ads are typically more successful as text ads, but you do have the option of using image ads. If using a text ad, it’s crucial to have an engaging and relevant headline with the CTA on the second line. Make sure the copy is relevant to the keywords and keep the copy short (less than 70 characters). If using an image ad, be sure you’re adhering to the search engine’s recommended image sizes to ensure a good viewing experience on desktop and mobile.

Using SEM alone could be highly beneficial, but with marketing automation, it can take your efforts to the next level. Marketing automation allows you to see a more complete picture of which keywords are performing best. While many businesses turn to Google Analytics for a snapshot of how well an SEM ad is driving traffic to their site, Google Analytics can’t provide information on how well Bing ads or other search engine ads performed, but marketing automation tools can. Marketing automation tools let you have a comprehensive view of your SEM efforts by allowing you to see how visitors are interacting and behaving with your ads and website. Because marketing automation enables you to track and connect keywords to a prospect, you will be better able to nurture them into leads by meeting them where they are in the sales funnel with relevant content.

blog_instagram-strategies-that-build-fol.title: Instagram Strategies That Build Followers & Engagement | Prime Marketing Experts
blog_instagram-strategies-that-build-fol.description: Social Media has completely redefined the way businesses attract new clients. As more customers spend a considerable part of their day browsing online, it is imperative for businesses to establish a presence on their favorite online platforms, especially Instagram.
h1: Instagram Strategies That Build Followers & Engagement
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuInstagram Strategies That Build Followers & EngagementSocial Media has completely redefined the way businesses attract new clients. As more customers spend a considerable part of their day browsing online, it is imperative for businesses to establish a presence on their favorite online platforms, especially Instagram.
Michael Krieger

Social Media has completely redefined the way businesses attract new clients. As more customers spend a considerable part of their day browsing online, it is imperative for businesses to establish a presence on their favorite online platforms, especially Instagram.

Instagram has shown tremendous growth in its uptake since its launch in late 2010. It is mostly visual – and requires communication through images and videos. It is the most popular social media platform among Gen Z and millennials. Today, about 500 million subscribers access the app daily making it the third most popular social media platform after Facebook and YouTube. And for these reasons, it is important for businesses to expand their marketing programs to Instagram in order to reach their potential customers.

If you are interested to know how Instagram can help you to grow your business, here are some tips to help you get started. While many think that marketing on Instagram is primarily relevant for B2C, it is also helpful for reaching B2B prospects.

You can start by setting up your profile and connecting your Facebook business page. Ensure that your bio description includes a brief description about your business and the areas you serve. Use your business logo, name, and website address in the profile so that it is easier for customers to find you.
Once your page is listed, it is important for you to build a follower community called which is a group of people who have shown interest in receiving your account’s updates as they are posted.
One quick way to grow this base is by inviting your Facebook community to follow your Instagram account. You may also invite friends/followers from other social networks.

Another strategy is to follow your potential customer base yourself and engage with them by either liking or commenting on their posts. Not all, but some of them will follow you back. Ensure that you do not end up spamming or commenting unnecessarily on personal posts.
You may also ask your employees to follow you and you should post a link to your Instagram profile on your company’s website.

blog_the-7-latest-marketing-technology-p.title: The 7 Latest Marketing Technology Platforms That Boost Business Growth | Prime Marketing Experts
blog_the-7-latest-marketing-technology-p.description: Business leaders should consider upgrading to the latest marketing technology to boost business growth through increased conversion and SEO rankings.
h1: The 7 Latest Marketing Technology Platforms That Boost Business Growth
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuThe 7 Latest Marketing Technology Platforms That Boost Business GrowthBusiness leaders should consider upgrading to the latest marketing technology to boost business growth through increased conversion and SEO rankings.
Michael Krieger
Business leaders should consider upgrading to the latest marketing technology to boost business growth through increased conversion and SEO rankings.

Marketing automation is a blend of 8 different marketing technology tools that work together to simplify your business and to maximize the results of your marketing campaign. It is a proven way to increase revenue through boosted conversion rates, especially in businesses that have a higher profitability per sale and longer sales cycles. Implementing marketing automation helps businesses generate a higher volume of leads from their current website traffic. Marketing automation helps track how users navigate your website, interact with social media, and engage with your email campaigns. The system then calculates a score for each individual user on your website based on their likelihood that they will convert into becoming a customer. You can also automate repetitive tasks, such as sending out lead nurturing emails, as well as monitoring the status of sales and prospects. This will only help your team focus on creating and executing new lead generation campaigns.

However, many businesses are reluctant to deploy marketing automation solutions due to the associated cost. Fear not! We like calculating ROI as well. In our experience, we find that clients can make ROI from marketing automation services when accounting for the increased productivity of just one salesperson in most cases.

Especially that email is one of the least costly ways to market your business, upgrading your email service to a platform with DomainKeys Identified Mail (DKIM) is critical if your business has a large email contact list. DKIM-based email campaign services, which is included in our marketing automation service, can protect against domain spoofing and phishing attacks. Since these emails are more credible to recipients’ email services, they are more likely to be delivered into the recipients’ inboxes. Therefore, DKIM-based email campaigns typically get a 400% improvement in open rates over non-DKIM-based email campaigns.

Deploying landing pages drives results as you are effectively collecting prospect information on your website. In essence, you would offer something that your website visitors would value, such as a white paper or a free shipping coupon, in exchange for key contact information such as an email address and a phone number. In turn, you build a list of email addresses from prospects that you may market to repeatedly. This process streamlines marketing because these contacts have a high likelihood of converting with a properly constructed lead nurturing campaign. In essence, the campaign gradually builds a relationship with these contacts as studies have shown that you need to make an average of 7 touches with a prospect before they convert. We recommend building landing pages with a separate landing page tool, such as Instapage or the integrated tool within our marketing automation service.

Creating visually stunning offers through leveraging marketing technology can help reduce cart abandonment or build an email list. Our most favorite time to deploy them is by triggering a pop up advertisement that appears when users are exiting your website. Though, you can opt to create the offer in more subtle ways, including by having bars on top or on the side of your webpages. We recommend integrating OptInMonster which offers a best in class platform to easily incorporate these offers into your website.

Heat map tools provide a visual representation of what users care about most in your website by tracking clicks on your website. You can then utilize this data to more effectively make decisions on how to better optimize the placement of your website elements. Heat maps also may deliver information on where users are clicking. Perhaps you have an icon on a website that is not linked to another area of your website, but people are expecting to view more information on a specific aspect of your service. You can clearly see the degree of user intent your website visitor base has through viewing the degree of heat pictured in each page’s heat map. In contrast, you cannot see this if you are using Google Analytics, especially if you have the same link on multiple areas of the same page.

If you wish to implement heat maps, check out Lucky Orange. Lucky Orange is especially helpful to see exactly when a user scrolls and clicks on your website as it has the ability to show recordings of exactly what happens.

blog_local-seo-hacks-that-spark-business.title: Local SEO Hacks That Spark Business Growth | Prime Marketing Experts
blog_local-seo-hacks-that-spark-business.description: When thinking about search engine optimization, or SEO, people tend to just think it is the process of how websites or videos can be optimized to appear more prominently within search engines.
h1: Local SEO Hacks That Spark Business Growth
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuLocal SEO Hacks That Spark Business GrowthWhen thinking about search engine optimization, or SEO, people tend to just think it is the process of how websites or videos can be optimized to appear more prominently within search engines.
Michael Krieger

When thinking about search engine optimization, or SEO, people tend to just think it is the process of how websites or videos can be optimized to appear more prominently within search engines. While this is still a significant part of SEO, businesses with a physical location also need to focus on their local SEO rank to drive increased visibility. Of particular interest, local SEO provides prime visibility when users search for a locally relevant term, which triggers a local search pack that displays 3 nearby businesses immediately under a map. Local search engine rankings are mainly driven by creating citations within business directories to support the visibility of your business. These searches give customers the option to call your local business directly, read recent reviews, or get directions to your location. Businesses that service their customers in-person can boost their visibility online by making sure their business shows up in search results when users need to find them.
Google Local Search Pack Displayed When Searching “Plumber Boston.”

Before setting up your local business listing, you’ll first want to check your eligibility to create a listing within Google My Business (GMB). Online-only businesses, artists, and organizations are not eligible for a Google My Business listing. Check each platform’s guidelines on what determines eligibility.

When you have determined that you are eligible to list on specific platforms, you would want to check if a listing already exists for the business. Sometimes there may discover that you have a profile when you are not aware one is present, though it may be severely basic and incomplete. Having complete and correct information within your business listing improves your ranking when users search for terms relevant to the business category.

To claim your listing, you’ll want to review the information that may have already been provided to ensure accurate information, especially since consistency is key. Each platform is different, but the basic information that helps search engines geolocate your business includes business name, address, and phone number, which is often referred to as NAP. Including a business description and links to social media accounts often enhances it further. Some even allow you to upload other media such as menus and pictures of your business. Once you’ve updated or corrected the information, you may have to proceed through an email, phone, or mail verification process as required by each platform.

When you have verified your business listings and have established a profile on the greatest amount of business directories, traditional SEO comes into play to further improve your local SEO ranking. This starts with keyword research to use for your content, which will improve your SEO ranking. Begin by researching what your customers search for. Then, plan content around those topics to improve your ranking in a platform’s search results.

If you are a local custom furniture shop, you could write a blog about repurposing an old chair or distressed furniture. Long-tail keywords for these topics are likely to be “how to repurpose a chair” or “how to restore distressed furniture.” The short-tail keywords would more likely be “repurpose chair” and “restore furniture.” Researching keywords that best fit your business gives you the best chance to produce useful content around what your customers are searching for. In researching keywords, you could even create content based on search trends that are relevant to the services you offer.

Focus more on short-tail keywords. Typically when focusing on search engine marketing, or SEM, long-tail keywords are the way to go because a customer is closer to finding the solution to their need. Long-tail keywords are always useful, however with local SEO, you’ll want to pay attention to short-tail keywords because of the volume of searches, plus it may trigger local SEO. There is no bidding with local SEO, but since short-tail keywords are more likely to be competitive, planning your content to achieve high local search ranking becomes even more important. Try experimenting by entering different searches to see which keywords trigger the local search pack for your area. In the screenshot below, the search term “emergency plumbing,” triggered local SEO even without the words “near me” or the name of the city in the search.

h1: 8 Email Marketing Strategies That Will Boost Sales
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menu8 Email Marketing Strategies That Will Boost SalesEmail marketing is one of the most underrated, yet beneficial strategies ever invented to generate worthy leads. A 2015 study by the DMA found that for every $1 spent, email campaigns have an average of $38 return on investment (ROI). Michael Krieger

Email marketing is one of the most underrated, yet beneficial strategies ever invented to generate worthy leads. A 2015 study by the DMA found that for every $1 spent, email campaigns have an average of $38 return on investment (ROI). Email marketing is surprisingly cheap and effective enough in keeping in touch with your customers. As such, you need to come up with an effective strategy to achieve your set goals.
Your email marketing campaign strategy must answer these four Ws:
What is your message? Why do you want to send it out? When do you want to send it? Who are the email recipients?
Email marketing is the key to establishing great relationships with both existing and potential clients. Building these relationships is key to encouraging repeat purchases from your customers!
Below are some proven tips and strategies that will elevate your email marketing from basic to platinum performance:
Build an audience

Before starting any email marketing, make sure you have an email list of individuals or organizations in your target market. Email marketing has evolved from mass email blasts to targeted, market-specific campaigns. Today, businesses focus less on mass email communication and more on strategically addressing market needs. Did you know that about 99% of website visitors don’t usually take any action on their first visit? So how do you capture this audience – most of which may never visit your website again?

Building an audience takes effort. You need to research and strategically grow your email list with contacts that fit your target demographics. A website opt-in is a great place to capture your potential market. The other key strategy to build an email list is to deploy lead magnets. A lead magnet is an enticing offer provided by a business in exchange for a potential client's contact information. It can be anything, like a contact form for newsletter sign-ups, quote requests, or coupon downloads!

paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuThe Ultimate Guide for Small Business Owners to Build an Effective WebsiteIn the ever-evolving digital landscape, having a strong online presence is essential for small business owners looking to compete and thrive in today's market. A well-designed and effective website serves as a powerful marketing tool, helping businesses reach more customers, establish credibility, and increase sales.
Michael Krieger

In the ever-evolving digital landscape, having a strong online presence is essential for small business owners looking to compete and thrive in today's market. A well-designed and effective website serves as a powerful marketing tool, helping businesses reach more customers, establish credibility, and increase sales. However, building a successful website can be challenging without the right knowledge and guidance. In this comprehensive guide, we will explore the key steps and strategies that small business owners need to follow to create an impactful online presence. From choosing the right design elements to optimizing for search engines and engaging visitors with compelling content, this ultimate guide will provide valuable insights and practical tips to help you build a successful website that drives results for your business. Whether you're just starting out or looking to revamp your existing site, this article is your go-to resource for harnessing the power of the internet to grow your small business effectively.
Having a website for your small business is crucial in today's digital age. It serves as a 24/7 online storefront that can attract potential customers from all corners of the internet.
Online Presence: A website provides credibility and legitimacy to your business, making it easier for customers to find you.
Reach More Customers: With a website, you can reach a broader audience beyond your local area.
Marketing Tool: Your website can serve as an effective marketing tool to showcase products or services and engage with customers.
In conclusion, investing in a well-designed website is not just an option but a necessity for small businesses looking to thrive in today's competitive market.

Identify your purpose: Clearly define what you want to achieve with your website. Is it to generate leads, sell products, provide information, or establish credibility? Understanding your primary goal is crucial for designing an effective website.

Set SMART objectives: Create specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goals for your website. For example, increasing online sales by 20% in the next six months or capturing 100 new leads per month. This will help you track progress and ensure that your website is driving real results for your business.

Additionally, users now post video content to further develop relationships with their audience.

With over 1 million monthly users, Instagram is a powerful platform for increasing ROI for businesses with a decent following. To succeed on Instagram, post the right content and images to build an effective marketing strategy.

Forrester Research reports that Instagram has an engagement rate of 4.21%, measuring the percentage of likes, comments, and shares relative to impressions. Attractively designing your story is paramount to getting more people to notice your content. Great design is a critical element to maintain high engagement and convert followers into customers. h1: Content Gating: Use These Sure-Shot Tips For Boosting Email List Growth
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuContent Gating: Use These Sure-Shot Tips For Boosting Email List GrowthIf you are a digital marketer, then at least once in your professional life, you have thought about how you could possibly generate 100 leads...
Michael Krieger

If you are a digital marketer, then at least once in your professional life, you have thought about how you could possibly generate 100 leads within your site in a single day. This is a dream of every astute and hard-working marketer. However, there is always something that becomes a hindrance in your path towards your vision.

Content is the most important aspect to display on your website among your customers. Most experienced marketers have advised using gated content on the site. Some of you may be thinking about what gated content is, and how it can further brand positioning efforts in your company.

Content gating is the process in which you place content that requires visitors to provide their contact details so that they can view a complete article of their interest. Most digital marketers offer the best quality of the information in the form of gated content and generate details by getting their email address, name, and contact number in exchange for the information.
Create Captivating Content

To successfully create a content gating strategy, you need to gather lots of information to create captivating content. Ensure the content you have written is useful for the visitors and attractive for prospects to effectively gain thought leadership.
Therefore, your content will also become valuable for readers. Using this strategy to create your content with passion will result in a good number of successful leads.
Build a Landing Page

After creating content, you have to ultimately convince your audience by taking them to a new navigation page that allows them to fill their personal information. To create a landing page, you need to create an attractive headline. You could add the beginning of a blog article that you are featuring to try to engage your visitors.

blog_google-vs-bing-ads:-which-is-best-j.title: Google Vs Bing Ads: Which is Best? | Prime Marketing Experts
blog_google-vs-bing-ads:-which-is-best-j.description: You should compare Google vs Bing Ads to maximize the success of your campaigns when you turn to search engine advertising to help your business...
h1: Google Vs Bing Ads: Which is Best?
h2: Let the Google Vs Bing Ads Contest Begin!
Managing the Optimal Balance In Your PPC Campaigns
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuGoogle Vs Bing Ads: Which is Best?You should compare Google vs Bing Ads to maximize the success of your campaigns when you turn to search engine advertising to help your business...
Michael Krieger

You should compare Google vs Bing Ads to maximize the success of your campaigns when you turn to search engine advertising to help your business grow. Both platforms offer pros and cons that should make any business owner give their decision a second look.

The biggest pro of Google is that it’s the most widely used search engine in the United States by a long shot. Currently, 62.5% of searches originate from Google. On mobile search, Google’s dominance is even bigger.

When you consider the other platforms available to you under the Google umbrella (Google Maps, Google Shopping, Gmail, YouTube, and Google Partner Sites), there are many opportunities for your ads to be seen.

This is advantageous for businesses because most people (and your customers) are going to be using Google platforms when searching for products and services that your business offers. You want to be where your customers are, so concentrating your SEM efforts on Google would be a good start.
Google Ads features have auto-tagging, which helps you automatically set up and track offline conversions, whereas it has to be set up manually in Bing Ads.

Speaking of conversions, conversion rate reports offered within Google Ads are customizable versus you have to download a full report when working within Bing Ads. There are several features and customizable tools available that will give Google the upper hand whenever comparing certain categories and the included features are one of them.

Click fraud is a huge overall problem in search engine advertising as competitors and automated bots can maliciously click advertisements. Google has more robust anti-fraud systems and accepts automated refund requests for fraudulent clicks that 3rd party software detects.

We mentioned that the biggest pro was that Google dominates the search engine game, although that comes with competition. Since that’s where the majority of everyone’s customers are going to be, this means that you’re going to be competing with many numerous businesses for the same people you’re trying to reach.

h1: Strategies For Small Business Growth In The Digital Era
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuStrategies For Small Business Growth In The Digital EraIn today’s digital world, small businesses must adapt and leverage technology to grow and thrive. With the rise of social media, mobile devices, and new digital platforms, there are many opportunities for small business owners to reach new customers, streamline operations, and boost revenues. However, it can be challenging to know where to start without the right strategies and plans in place. This article will provide valuable insights and practical tips to help position your small business for sustainable growth in the digital marketplace.
Michael Krieger

In today’s digital world, small businesses must adapt and leverage technology to grow and thrive. With the rise of social media, mobile devices, and new digital platforms, there are many opportunities for small business owners to reach new customers, streamline operations, and boost revenues. However, it can be challenging to know where to start without the right strategies and plans in place. This article will provide valuable insights and practical tips to help position your small business for sustainable growth in the digital marketplace.
Securing Budget For Your Startup

One of the first steps to implementing an effective digital strategy is securing budget for your startup. Many digital initiatives like building a website, running online ads, or developing a mobile app require upfront investment. Determine how much you can allocate to your digital presence and marketing efforts. If budgets are tight, focus on affordable tactics like content marketing, social media engagement, and SEO optimization. Leverage free and low-cost tools whenever possible, and track results to calculate your return on investment.
Redesigning A Website

Your website is often the first touchpoint between your small business and potential new customers. That’s why redesigning a website should be a top priority for business owners. Ensure your site is mobile-friendly with fast load times. Refresh the content to speak to your target audience better. Include clear calls to action to drive conversions. Update online forms and integrations with marketing automation software. Enhance SEO elements like meta descriptions, tags, and alt text. Improving your website experience aligns with shifting consumer expectations and positions your brand as contemporary and tech-savvy.
Optimizing For Search Engines

Gaining visibility on search engines like Google is imperative for small business growth today. You want your brand to appear prominently in local search results so nearby customers can easily find you. Conduct keyword research to understand high-value terms and phrases related to your products or services. Strategically incorporate these keywords, page titles, headers, image names, and metadata in your website copy. Produce fresh blog content that answers consumer questions and needs. Build high-quality backlinks from other relevant websites to boost domain authority. Use free digital tools like Google My Business to stand out in local search listings with your name, address, and phone number.
Leveraging Social Media

Digital marketing represents a comprehensive approach to promoting businesses, products, and services using digital channels and technologies. Digital marketing encompasses all marketing efforts that utilize electronic devices and the internet. Digital marketing enables businesses to precisely target specific audiences, track performance in real-time, and adjust strategies immediately, unlike traditional marketing methods.

blog_how-to-leverage-the-best-instagram-.description: For many businesses, it may seem that it is almost next to impossible to conquer ever-changing algorithms on popular social media platforms such as Instagram. However, there are some useful growth hacks that can be used without trying to reinvent the wheel that still result in growth in followers, increases in engagement, and more interested prospects.
h1: How To Leverage The Best Instagram Growth Hacks in 2025
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuHow To Leverage The Best Instagram Growth Hacks in 2025For many businesses, it may seem that it is almost next to impossible to conquer ever-changing algorithms on popular social media platforms such as Instagram. However, there are some useful growth hacks that can be used without trying to reinvent the wheel that still result in growth in followers, increases in engagement, and more interested prospects.
Michael Krieger

Businesses often struggle with keeping up with the constantly changing algorithms of popular social media platforms like Instagram. Prepare to grow your followers, engagement, and profitability when you deploy these Instagram growth hacks without reinventing the wheel!

Before you begin trying to grow your Instagram account, it’s important to take some time to create a detailed strategy. This will serve as a roadmap to help you achieve your goals for Instagram growth. Start by specifying the goals for your Instagram account. Specify your target number of followers, leads, and sales you want to reach by a specific date.

It is best to create a content creation strategy to maximize engagement with your target audience. Furthermore, people often follow a page because they believe the content within it was exceptional. To attract your target audience, share appealing photos or videos. It would be beneficial to hire a graphic artist or a videographer to enhance your brand perception. You should also strategize how you would include different types of content, including product-oriented, user-generated, or customer-focused.

We also recommend defining how often you plan to post each content category. The 80/20 Rule states that 20% of your content should be promotional, while 80% should engage your Instagram audience emotionally.

Consider engaging with posts on Instagram related to your business on other accounts. It has the potential to significantly enhance the visibility of your brand. Focus on recent posts for better engagement on Instagram.
Monitor your account and leverage user-generated content for social proof. This builds trust with your audience and highlights why they should choose your business over competitors.

Create a landing page and add the link to your Instagram bio. This will make it simple for your followers to visit important links. Use this page to direct traffic and convert your Instagram followers into clients.

Use a post scheduler to manage a content calendar and find the best times to share your posts. Tracking and comparing your performance with competitors can enhance the effectiveness of the Instagram growth strategies used by your business.

case-studies_the-6-most-effective-method.title: The 6 Most Effective Methods to Differentiate Your Business | Prime Marketing Experts
case-studies_the-6-most-effective-method.description: Successful business owners differentiate their companies to effectively grow sales profitably, while improving client loyalty within a...
h1: The 6 Most Effective Methods to Differentiate Your Business
paragraphs: Business Marketing Technology BlogContactFree Strategy SessionOpen menuThe 6 Most Effective Methods to Differentiate Your BusinessSuccessful business owners differentiate their companies to effectively grow sales profitably, while improving client loyalty within a...

Successful business owners differentiate their companies to effectively grow sales profitably, while improving client loyalty within a competitive business environment. Businesses that successfully differentiate themselves effectively structure their value proposition to offer features that their competitors do not offer, or they have a more efficient business process that yields cost savings which allows them to pass on the savings to their customers in the form of lower pricing.

Increase Your Value Perception -When customers perceive that your product’s value, stylishness, or class is differentiated, your sales increase because of your offering’s improved value proposition. Businesses often differentiate themselves by creating a perception that they offer better quality given the price they pay.Simply becoming the lowest cost supplier can be the most ideal strategy when you are selling a commodity when you have no other opportunity to differentiate.Many businesses find that highlighting donations triggerred by sales increases value perception because it makes their customers happy as they perceive that the business is involved in the community. According to Rachel Lamb of Luxury Daily, 20% of consumers are willing to pay a higher price when it supports a cause, while 94% of them will switch to a brand that supports a cause from one that does not.You could also increase the trustworthiness of your brand by asking prior customers to provide testimonials. In turn, your prospective customers will understand that other customers have had a good experience with your company in the past, which will increase the value perception of your business.Your company’s market research could suggest that you should implement a guarantee to increase customer satisfaction. Keep in mind that any failure to deliver upon the guarantee that you implement will cause people to lose confidence in your brand.Some businesses target time-crunched customers by offering a more convenient shopping experience. In this case, extending your hours of operation or opening locations in more convenient locations may drive positive results for your company. However, business owners who deploy this tactic must analyze whether they would be profitably increasing sales as this increases operating costs.Creating an exclusive club that offers your clients experiences only available through your business or by spending a certain amount of money each year could differentiate your business. On the same token, offering a more luxurious experience may result in customers going to great lengths to patronize your business.

Improve the Perceived Quality or Opulence of Your Offering – Established brands could whip you out of the market because of their financial muscle and their more developed brand perception. To beat them, you need to focus on other areas apart from the price, such as the quality or opulence of your offering.For example, a candy business could differentiate its product on taste, convenient packaging, or ingredients. As such, the consumer is willing to pay a premium for the additional value created by this differentiation. Luxury car manufacturers could associate their vehicles with class and style as wealthier customers will easily be willing to pay a higher price due to the opulence and the status symbol that the car offers.

Service Self-Employed & Startup Businesses – Self-employed professionals and startup businesses have the most potential to reshape our world for the better, but are the most vulnerable area of our workforce and can be great opportunities to build a long term relationship with as they can be underserved. Making sure that you have relevant product or service offerings for them will ensure that your business is well-positioned for further growth. In turn, your business remains top of mind when these businesses grow as you have gradually built a relationship by offering a scaled down solution of your services to meeds their needs.

Increase Client Loyalty – Increase loyalty amongst your clients to set your offering apart from other companies. While this starts with improving quality, there are other considerations to encourage customers to return to your business.You could utilize marketing automation to increase the personalization of your marketing messaging. Customers who trust that you are delivering a service of superior value will be happy to provide their personal information to you. In turn, this enables you to personalize your service towards the customer, which plays a role in 86% of purchasing decisions according to Infosys. Additionally, 73% of customers prefer to do businesses that utilize their personal information to make their shopping experience more relevant. Businesses then can develop user-generated profile platforms to gain emotionally intelligent insights and customer opt-in solutions, which increases customer loyalty.

Increase The Level Of Customer Service That Your Company Offers – The customer is always right, and it is important to ensure the satisfaction of your customers since it costs five times as much to attract a new customer versus what it costs to keep a customer. When you provide customers with a good experience, 81% of your clients will patronize your business again and will spend 9% more than a new customer. When you fail to provide a good experience, 51% of your clients will not return to your business.

Utilize Social Media To Elevate Your Brand – Social media is a prime communication medium to express customer appreciation. In fact, 81% of clients listen when a brand executive has something to say on social media; and in turn, their confidence increases when you provide relevant information that appeals to them.One pro tip that you should consider giving a gift or complimentary upgrade to your loyal social media advocates. While the cost to your company is minimal, it is highly likely that your advocate will post about this surprising experience which will only provide more customers and positive exposure for your brand.

Differentiating your business can be costly, but it will often result in greater long term profitability. Therefore, your marketing messaging should resonate as much as possible with your target audience in a way that creates a perception that your offering is differentiated!
